headline: 'It's been a magical run': Ohio Gov. DeWine says Bengals fandom could be felt throughout the state
author: WLWT Digital Staff
sentences: Though the Super Bowl is over, these fans were still fired up after an amazing season and they wanted the team to know though they didn't bring home the trophy, they're proud of how hard they worked this year.
We had two years of pandemic and people making sacrifices and people needed something to make 'em happy and this team has made them happy, across the state," DeWine said.
Mike DeWine says the Bengals fandom could be felt throughout the state as the team celebrates a historic run to the Super Bowl.
I was talking to somebody the other day that said this season lasted longer than they were used to.
It's great so it's not going to be too long till we're back into football again," DeWine said.
"It's been a magical run I think part of it is underdogs, no one expected them to do this.
When it comes to next season, the governor said he's already looking forward to it.
DeWine was in attendance at the city's rally honoring the team at Washington Park.
These are players I think people can really relate to," DeWine said.
I think people really feel connected to the team.
Fans are also looking forward to the next season.
He said the season has been awesome to watch.
"I can't wait till the season starts.
